conclusion: Problem involves determining shadow changes when light source moves backwards
Objects and shadows are labeled A, B, C, and D
Need to consider location and size changes of shadows
Understanding of shadow formation: formed when object blocks light
Position and size of shadow depend on light source and object position
If light source moves, shadow moves and possibly changes size
Shadow is formed on side opposite to light source
Longer distance between object and light source results in shorter shadow
Closer object to light source results in longer shadow
When light source moves, shadow moves in opposite direction
Light source moving farther makes shadow smaller, closer makes it larger
Light source is moving backwards in this problem
Determine changes for shadows A, B, C, and D
Object A is a birdcage
Shadow A is labeled A
Shadow A should move towards the object as light moves away
Shadow A should become smaller as light source moves farther
Object B looks like a red box with a black base
Shadow B is labeled B
Shadow B should move towards the object as light moves away
Shadow B should become smaller as light source moves farther
Object C appears to be a black lamp or cylindrical object
Shadow C is labeled C
Shadow C should move towards the object as light moves away
